wZQsd7Ujj1HbV0x4qDRIEg.text: Oh wow when I went to my jeweler. I found this restaurant is southern food at its best. Everything is homemade. I cannot get over the food the macaroni cheese got the collard greens the fried chicken meatloaf the porkchops the fish I could go on and on and now the place is very clean the fit people wear gloves everything is homemade maybe a little more than what I would normally would pay but well worth it. This is the place I keep taking my friendTo and everyone that I have taken has fell in love with the place the owner is a very friendly woman

AvkunarYfzJ14-92GYydBg.text: Food was soulful and seasoned to perfection. Reasonable prices with healthy served amount. I had chicken greens (sweet) and yams and Mac and cheese. Plan on trying the cabbage. I don't care for sugar in greens but they weren't bad. Yams were good as well. Mac and cheese was my favorite side item.

V3eHfwXk2Su2TyZXsVFfrQ.text: Upon entering the restaurant I received a warm welcome, but as soon as I walked to the serving line I experienced a server that was obviously not having a good day.  I ordered the baked chicken, collards and cabbage (to go).  Asked the server for some gravy from the baked chicken and I guess she thought  I asked for one of her limbs.  (light skinned lady with a bad attitude) The food was average and unfortunately I probably won't go again.  Attitude determines your altitude!

8gHOVJpyQPxrrpJ4teVlvQ.text: Excellent food and service.  I had the meatloaf, collard greens and green beans with cornbread and a taste of yams.  All yummy!!!

ptYK46aNna9h4N_zen7d5g.text: The food is great! Everybody has a nice personality and they're very welcoming. I had the fried chicken, rice, collard greens, macaroni and cheese, yams, along with peach cobbler. Everything tasted amazing and reminded me of the food my family prepares. I'm originally from Charleston, SC so this food hit home!

I71NodqHr-IHyIRaG5GEQw.text: It's souls food people. And it's close by on an end where there are few options. Good home cooked meals in a Christian environment with subtle gospel playing in the background. The people were really nice and courteous. Greens are seasoned without pork. Several of the desserts were homemade as well but I passed.  Banana pudding available on Thursday through the weekend. They currently close at 7 pm during the week and Saturdays at 5 pm?? So hopefully you'll crave your soul food early.

gXBs-QT8pBR69-ZgSsF4yA.text: Wonderful service, delicious food, friendly atmosphere, and CLEEEEANNNN!!! I had the ribs and Mac and cheese my better half had the fried pork chop which was cooked to order. Everything is presented well and the team is ready to serve with a smile and the prices are fair.

aNPrH7zPh6UIRiAq5UZVSg.text: For a first visit to a new restaurant you have an open mind. Was not needed. This is a place that the west side needs. Great southern food , friendly staff and reasonable prices. Generous portions and the banana pudding was the bomb. Definitely will visit again. Highly recommend a visit for those looking for the taste of great home cooking.

WKzfXe4WM2PPgs7WqiUc1A.text: Very good soul food!  Taste like home made...really!  Once they figure out how to speed up the ordering/serving process this will be hands down the best restaurant in the area.

VBnp1DFDW4gcKYfj3NO-UQ.text: This was my first time trying this place but I frequent the gym beside it (lol) and I can smell the food all the time. So I went on a Sunday afternoon; it wasn't too packed but there was a line. I had the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and cabbage. My friend had the fried chicken was potato salad and Mac and cheese. I tasted both of our plates, of course! The meats(both meat loaf and fried chicken) were delicious! Both flavorful and the chicken was fried to perfection! I was disappointed in the sides though. The mash potatoes weren't bad but felt like they were missing something. The Mac and cheese was good but I like "crumbles" I guess you can say, and this Mac was more of a smooth consistency. The cabbage really let me down, they lacked the most flavor. I did end up re-cooking them and adding some seasoning of my own to it. The potato salad was decent. Nothing to rave about.  However, the customer service were great! The ladies are so sweet and so nice and it's clean. If I were to go back it would be for the fried chicken for sure!

lTY3d8GKkT3FfaTNmJCZ-Q.text: Great food!! Love those collards and that great strawberry cobbler! We eat there every Sunday and often during the week.

VtPn-rsUhTrXsx2EFhKF1g.text: This a place hidden away in the Brookshire-Mt. Holly Huntersville area where the food will knock your socks off. The food is so delicious and good. It will make you rare back full when you finish eating. Very highly recommended.

n01FwiCTblM5qlwvyq6-_A.text: Always wanted to visit this place after all the great reviews. Surprised at how empty the place was but maybe this after the lunch rush. Regardless, the staff was very nice and attentive. Ordered meatloaf, Mac and cheese and green beans. Also a second order with smothered pork chop with same sides. Got home and the food was still very hot,smelled great and tasted very good. Only ate half since its stick to your ribs but about 30-40 min later both of us were very thirsty, bloated and started to have the sweats. The food didn't taste salty so they must have used MSG or a lot of seasoning salts which can hide the salt taste. Been to other soul food establishments and didn't have this issue. Won't be back since I don't need that much sodium.

LBJ2ycFXy3X9JMeygh8uLw.text: Food is very good but wait time has always been 30 or more minutes standing in line when I have visited. It seems that if there was at least 3 people fixing plates at all times the line would move faster.

5xhOu43JsepAKK7FCrXwXg.text: I must say, the food here definitely reminds me of my grandma's cooking. I had seen other reviews for this place on the Next Door app and decide to give it a try. My mom and I was very pleased and very full. Not only that bumped into my cousin and her family. She frequents the place often. I will definitely be a frequent flyer, especially for those yams!

G5Dkiom2hWMjPvc5TCpsSw.text: I was greeted by a big beautiful smile when I walked into Londa's from Londa herself!! She is filled with southern charm and her food just compliments her demeanor. I had the Crocker fish and it was delicious!!!! The food is perfectly seasoned, the atmosphere is clean, and the employees are all equally as nice a Londa. I suspect that soon she'll have a line out the door. It's very nice and spacious. Great location with plenty of parking. I'll definitely be back!!!!

FhL2JvNJd00d5cx_YDTjyA.text: Not fancy, BUT super clean, great service, delicious food.  I ordered meatloaf, mac and cheese, and sweet potato casserole.  Oh, and peach cobbler.  Delish!! I will be back for the fried chicken.

0TYVOVUKG-UgaiekYYO0Kg.text: We welcome Londa's Place to the mountain island area and we've waited so long for someone to reopen this location as a restaurant. Upon entering we was greeted with smiles and 2-3 employees spoke to us.   The place smells like a thanksgiving dinner in the oven and tables and floors are clean as if nobody has eaten there all day.   Everything was buffet style and the food was steaming hot and looked fresh. I had The Beef Ribs with Greens along with Mac and cheese and it was very good and it tasted very good.   The sweet tea was good this is a must visit place and trust me there is plenty of food to choose from such as turkey legs chicken baked or fried pinto beans green beans collard greens and even stuffing they even have desserts to choose from.   I know this is a big statement but I will say it's the best buffet served restaurant I've ever eaten at seriously.

69O84MGdrW1Zy2FHFu3IXQ.text: It was okay. I had sliced turkey wings kind of salty and very tough. Mac and cheese was just that macaroni and cheddar no cream or anything, cabbage was the best thing on my plate. I had the pineapple cake it was wet down with pineapple juice if that's the way you like your cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

GfS3IBaOHSvJNGX316TjIw.text: Can't wait to go back here for dinner. I went on anThursday at 11:00 right at opening. Very clean looking restaurant and seem to have nice staff. Everyone was dress professionally and clean uniforms. I got the stew chicken over rice and two sides. Mac n cheese and mashed potatoes. They had all types of green vegetables but I wanted to taste all the starchy foods. . I enjoyed my meal. Price was $10.52 with no drink. However the price was very good for all the food you get. Neither less to say I saved some for dinner. Can't wait to treat my family here.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

lXw-Yp9SWa96ieIY6sXBZw.text: The food was excellent. Mac and cheese, black eyed peas, collard greens, fried chicken and conbread. Collards tasted just like when my momma makes them!  I couldn't choose just 2 sides. Staff was very nice and helpful since it was my first time. Can't wait to go back and try the meatloaf!  Glad to have great place to eat on my side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything was hot and delicious!

fM3yXzlCeaaT1T6TBs5Q5A.text: Ordered food on Sunday and was told by my delivery person they didn't have the requested meat I asked for. I was stuck with the "smothered pork chops". Macaroni and cheese, collard greens were good but the pork chops were bland. They come with white rice and a brown gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

RRnO6cB_eZcROnwYLOdP3w.text: Just finished a very well prepared dinner of meatloaf, mashed potatoes/gravy and some good greens. Place was clean food was good and the staff was attentive.   The only thing that could improve are the amount of people eating there. Seriously if you want an enjoyable meal make this a must try

bXlhe-RVhSQ2x7gEn5Tt_Q.text: Expensive but the food was very good. A plate with a meat and two sides was a little over $16 with a drink.

pSOfGOvhMkv7F4MxDA5Z3g.text: Was ok. The register caught me off guard, was expensive for what I got. Seemed to be quite clean and staff were kind and attentive

bTwstfq_K5Mz7u0ZX-qnqg.text: Sorely disappointed to wait in line for 12 minutes to be told the fried chicken isn't ready.  Four people working the serving line and chaotic.  Need additional training to communicate with kitchen staff and runner.  No estimate on when Chicken would be ready other than "soon...I think!"  I waited an additional three minutes and finally left.  Owner unaware of lack of organization or scrambling gaps as she manned the register.  It is Sunday, the restaurant was less than a quarter capacity and quite disappointing. Clean and bar seemed hot, though the cold bar had mostly melted ice for the banana pudding containers.

bgSsUmpuPRPKKNyOkmMexA.text: Could be better. I've been twice and was very disappointed both times. But I want to like this place so bad, because it's close to home, customer service is good, and prices are great. I didn't do an initial review after my first visit, because I wanted my second visit to be a better one to post about. But it was worse.The first time I went I got the turkey wing plate with mac & cheese and yams. The flavor of the turkey wing was really good, but I was disappointed at the size. It should've been two wings. The yams were really good, but the mac and cheese was really dry. I couldn't even finish the mac and cheese because it wasn't enjoyable. Second trip, since I wanted more meat I got the turkey leg. The size was great. I was happy with it. Until I sat down. My first bite, the meat was hard and flavorless. It also tasted old. As I continued to try to eat it, it became clear that it was from the day before. It wasn't good at all. It was disgusting. It tasted old, was super hard, and tasted like it had no seasoning whatsoever. None. I decided to give the mac and cheese another shot and this time it was good. Much better than the first time and I was actually able to eat it. I got the yams again which were good. And the lemonade which was good as well. Plus the customer service has been great. I taste the potential, but I have just had bad experiences. If it were anywhere else I would never return after my experience with the turkey leg. But like I said, I want to like this place so bad. I think I'm going to give it one more shot, and hope the third time is a charm. If not, I'm done. I tired.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

hl6DMaqOb_-ZtdaN7KkjDQ.text: First time here and I loved how the young lady explained to me the different options of meats and sides they have as well as the drinks. Also, they serve big portions of food and prices are reasonable. I personally had the white chicken meal with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese and it was delicious. I'll definitely be going back to this place. The lemonade was really good too. Next time I should order two lemonades lol   Oh and it's a big plus how close it is to the highway ;)

DB3v4-mIjhO7DXHaT_QzJw.text: Great customer service ! The food was good. I took it to go and atmosphere appears clean and inviting.

ZMrEEg2t_AfHlA3Giq3ZaQ.text: This soul food  did just that... It hit the soul. Made me get the itis  right after. The food was bussin. I will most  definitely go back to that jawn. The bake chicken was fresh and Alicia Keys Fallin  off the bihnon!

rj6uMnmZD5bZBl8uov8Flw.text: Excellent cafeteria style restaurant! The food was prepared with good taste too. We really enjoyed have Thanksgiving Dinner at Londa's. The staff was very polite too. We highly recommend. Thank you Londa and staff!

zODHOtj_CjfDu_RPiak-kw.text: Did a takeaway order. The wait wasn't too bad as they were pretty fast and customer service was great. I just wish that they would constantly keep up with the food as they had run out of Mac n cheese, oxtail, etc... which would lead to someone waiting for another 30-40 minutes. Overall, the bbq chicken I end up getting was good with the collard greens and mashed potatoes. I'd definitely come back.

ClLWstQuLirn4_wVNdrcWA.text: The food and customer service at Londa's was amazing! Literally the best friend chicken I have ever had. I also was checked on during my meal, after my meal and had three different employees ask us if we wanted refills on our drinks before we left. I hope to see this place do really well with their business because they deserve it.

4iSJxAhZUc1v0eDyet7D-Q.text: Great local soul food. Just what was needed in the area, but even if Londas wasn't local Its still worth the drive. Excellent food, excellent service!  I love the meatloaf & mash potatoes.

2ljl-I9oxq4BPu_V6r9kGQ.text: It's ridiculous how good This food is EVERY single visit.  The facility is clean and well kept, ample seating, and it appears to be well staffed.  Good customer service.  The line can be long at times, but it moves fairly quickly, and the food is always worth the wait.  Do your self a favor- try to peach cobbler.

fCU4imHHzm4oh2WAeBTcKQ.text: The food is ok. I got the stewed chicken, mashed potatoes and collard greens. I didn't like the collard greens because they had no flavor and tasted sweet. The stewed chicken was dry and not seasoned. I asked for ox tails and was told they make them only on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays and then was told they had them. They didn't have a lot of desserts just cheesecake. I waited on fried chicken and mac and cheese and the lady stated the mac and cheese is coming out of the oven as and then they they have to put the cheese on it. I am confused because the cheese should already be on the mac and cheese. There wasn't enough food out and I was  told because they were short staffed. This was my first time here and things were disorganized and I was upset that I waited on fried chicken and mac and cheese and then get back in line and the lady tells me it is gone after I already paid for it. The prices are too much especially when the drink doesn't come with the meal. The cornbread is dry and hard. The location was clean and spacious it was just the food could be a lot better and hot and they need to have more than one person cooking so a variety of options of food can be served. The lemonade was too sweet and the tea was not sweet enough. I hope if I ever return it will be a better experience for me.

J_tZPhC4QqqCUjMYbCEw3A.text: Love it! Great spot for traditional soul food at reasonable prices. Staff are friendly and personable, making sure you get exactly what you asked for. The food is always fresh and season 2 perfection!

so8W7j__ENHjYuWuGMidXQ.text: Good quality soul food. Turkey wings were just what I needed. Green beans and collard greens were seasoned well. The mac'n cheese was sooo cheesy, definitely not stingy. We will be back. The takeout portion was large enough for two servings.

ljX2BLLJxLYMumNc0szyHw.text: I visited Londa's 's Place when it first opened and had a great experience.  It has now been over a year, and I finally went back yesterday. Let me just say that it is hard for a lot of establishments to keep up great quality the more quantity they prepare. That is definitely not the case with Londa's Place. On a Saturday afternoon the food was just as great as I remembered the first time. I decided to try the beef ribs, with mac and cheese and broccoli. The sauce on the ribs was simply wonderful! If it came out of a bottle I want  to know the name so I can buy it. The ribs themselves were well done and very, very tender. Their corn bread tastes like corn bread and not cake. It has good texture and taste. When I do visit, I like to eat in and enjoy the whole experience. The only thing not to my liking is the lemonade-- it is too sweet. Next time I'll drink water and enjoy the fabulous meal.

tpJhV1YACV-33TT2Oc3CDQ.text: The food was delicious! The only complaint my son had was the mashed potatoes being cold.  Everything otherwise was fresh and homemade! THAT PINEAPPLE CAKE BABYYYY! Must have! On top of all this the SERVICE was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

OgElv4r2ofbEUcx4CrK5rQ.text: Yay! I'm the first reviewer! So first, I'm so excited to a family style restaurant in this area and souls food on top of that is an added bonus! We found Londa's Place on Facebook and were lucky enough to eat there today during their soft opening.   Trust me you will get your whole southern Black grandma in the kitchen life when you see the food selection. I was starving so I'm glad they had food prepared already on the bar. I ordered fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, cabbage, and sweet potatoes and everything was seasoned to perfection. The only critique is that the Chicken was a little dry but I'm not taking off stars for that since it was a soft opening and their first day.   The staff were amazing and welcoming and accommodating and it gave me that family feel that should accompany any southern and soul food restaurant.   I'll definitely be back and before I left I said a little prayer for the success of this business. Shine on!

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken, baked macaroni and cheese, and cabbage.

afPUPCtfCMH4CmCj1YKQVQ.text: Traditional southern soul food presented cafeteria style. Everything is amazing with the exception of the baked chicken, it's been hit or miss (lacking in flavor at times). I eat here once a week. It's addition to the area. You can do take out our dine in and the dining area stays clean. Staff is warm and helpful. Try the peach or Apple cobbler, they're my favorite. My family goes crazy for the banana pudding. I typically don't like banana pudding but I enjoy it here!

X_6kY-XaMu-q6InmWYak5w.text: Very disappointing that the serving line is always disorganized on Sunday's. One patrons large order brought the entire line to a halt for 15 minutes. So the servers just waits rather than preparing orders for those of us in line. Improvement greatly needed to increase speed of service. I may avoid Sunday's all together and go elsewhere.  However, the food is delicious.

sSKBPX4V6JvmUk_IGa56lA.text: This is my second time visiting this establishment and I must say I am very pleased with the service and the food and desserts are delicious. I admire how this Carmel cake taste best yet hands down.

dWGWhVND5zwFFefcyI29Aw.text: Food is delicious and vibes are amazing!  The owner is very sweet! Not badly priced for the amount of food you are receiving.

k29KDWKgFz8jTBFTifV4uw.text: I was surprised to learn that this place had opened in the old CiCi's pizza location.  It is cafeteria style soul food at it's best.  I was able to swing by after church just before they opened at 11, and most of the food was ready with the exception of a few vegetables.  My son ordered the stewed chicken over rice, mac, green beans, and cornbread and he loved it all.  I ordered turkey wings over rice, collards, and green beans....I enjoyed everything except the green beans didn't seemed to be seasoned that well.  I also ordered a veggie plate of mac, dressing and gravy, and potato salad.....all were very good.  The desserts are mostly cake, and banana pudding.  The banana pudding was fresh and delish and overall everything was good on my first visit and my order was to go.  This restaurant is not new to the Charlotte area, as they were previously Koffee Kup on Tuckaseegee.  As I was leaving, the crowd was starting to build as it seems the word is out about Londa's in the mountain island area.

CU_F3SM1aI1Cwu-6YDY1yg.text: I have been here a few times and the food is so Great !! The days when I don't have time to cook or my mom or grandma is unavailable then this place hits the spot ! I do recommend for eating great soul food. It is a bit pricey though, I would love to see better specials or coupons !

-_VV-MMhAeDTOS_F4IXd2A.text: I went to Londa's today after church. Let's just say the line was out the door and the food was finger licking good.  Great food , clean establishment and professional.....  Thanks, Joy S.

a7P6qx7lX62ymqyYLTXuqQ.text: Merts, and Floyds have been in Charlotte for years and they dont serve food on plastic plates and use palstic forks and knives, they use real silverware. How can you cut a pork chop with a plastic fork? I guess thats why Shuffle Town is always crowded.

B98AwKS8pRUPGixEVhjlzA.text: I was passing through North Carolina, and happily found Londa's Place thanks to Yelp. The delicious food is matched with gracious hospitality. We were treated to carefully prepared southern soul food served fast and hot! The oxtail, which is only served on Sundays was delicious, ditto for the smothered pork chop. Stand out side dishes included the macaroni and cheese, dressing(with gravy) and the collard greens. The entire restaurant is spotlessly clean and welcoming. Skip the chain restaurants that are so ubiquitous on interstate exits and step into a warm food hug at Londa's Place!

DB9txBoIqRNxSzV5LDw8bA.text: The BEST soul food in the Charlotte area hands down !! Londa actually walks around the restaurant and makes sure u don't need anything , the atmosphere is amazing the staff is friendly, I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place.

it_qVudfH7YrBm0eVCYwdQ.text: This restaurant is a secret ready to be revealed.  The restaurant is buffet style (which they serve). One meat and two sides (majority of the specials/ menu) and drink included (I think). Prices are reasonable and food portions are good size. The atmosphere is dim in regards to lighting but very roomy. The staff is very friendly and pleasant.  Our family enjoyed their food on a Sunday after church.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids Meals, Chicken Leg, Green Beans, Rice and Gravy with Lemonade.
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken white meat, green beans, mac and cheese (not pictured).
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baked Dark Meat Chicken, Collard Greens and Mac And Cheese (not shown).

xAGjI9H26i8BmtKcaqy3Tg.text: So glad we stopped at Londa's They had a wide variety of choices and everything was great. The Green's and Mac & cheese were great and the Ox Tail. Some in my group had fried chicken and Beef ribs. Everyone cleaned their plates.   You can tell the owner works her business. Customer service was great, unlike a lot of places now.   Happy 1 year Anniversary Londa!  Hoping the community supports you and you have many more.

3M4DOT2U7LzEtGuZIHNqqA.text: Ehhh. I really wanted to like Londa's. I'm a southern woman so I've always found it hard to get good southern food in restaurants. The food here is served cafeteria style. Normal entree is a protein and 2 sides. I ordered the baked chicken with greens and Mac n cheese. It also comes with cornbread. The chicken wasn't bad. I'm not a fan of chicken on the bone but all in all. It was ok. The greens were too sweet. I know there are people who like sugar in their greens. I'm not one of them. The macaroni and cheese was down right bad. The noodles were over cooked which you can kind of see in the photos other reviewers have posted but I still wanted this to work out. It's a no for me. I don't see myself coming back to try anything else.

4s1jjX2UqFNNPMKlZXs_dw.text: Londa's Place is a nice addition to this side of town where if you want soul fool the closest you will get is Bojangles'. While the decor inside this restaurant is not glamourous one thing this place has is good food. I have been here twice now and both times I enjoyed the food.   The first time I ordered smothered steak w/ rice, macaroni & cheese, green beans, and corn bread. When I got home the food was hot, tasty, and very filling. The food was seasoned just right and I felt like I was eating Sunday dinner. The corn bread I thought was a little large of a serving size and just a tad bit dry but it complimented my meal. The second time I went I ordered stewed chicken w/ rice, sweet potatoes (or yams...whatever you call them), green beans, and corn bread. The chicken and rice was delicious and while I think I received the last in the pan of the sweet potatoes they had great flavor. I still felt the same as I did before regarding the corn bread so next time I may try a roll.   Prices are reasonable if you consider soul food prices at other notable restaurants in Charlotte. I wish hours were a little longer in the evening however this is a new restaurant and I understand they want to make sure they are getting an ROI. Both times I visited this location it was not very busy so I was able to order and receive my food quickly. I can say that both times I've been there the customer service was great. I was greeted and assisted promptly by the staff. The staff was nice and made sure I left with what I wanted. Customer service always is high on my list and in turn I can look pass the decor and other restaurant amenities you may see at other locations especially if you also have great food. I will definitely be back to this location.

MzDBObAWfgvq1_E_35nI1A.text: Londa, herself has a warm welcoming smile, which is clearly reflective in her new restaurant "Londa's Place".  This soul food, home cooking almost cafeteria style restaurant.  Offers a verity of yummy options on a they service you, your choice style buffet.  I enjoyed their meatloaf, mac & cheese and mash potatoes with corn bread!   My only feedback is, I hope they will turn on some music and/or get the tv's hooked up.  It's a little quiet environment without some back-ground noise.    I should add, this restaurant seams ideal for picking up a "home cooked" week night dinner.  The food was great, prices where on point, parking is convent and with the food already prepared seems like they could get it packed and have you on your way in no time.  Welcome to the neighborhood, we hope you'll stay around for a while!

htMY4qeeAe2t-xEAX3zrVA.text: I don't write reviews while sitting in a restaurant. Today was the exception. I walked in and was greeted kindly. The place is clean and orderly. That's always a nice touch. My vegetable plate included Mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, and greens. I cleaned the plate! I added a little pepper to the greens but other than that, the meal was scrumptious. I will be back (in my A. Schwarzenegger voice)!  Oh, the little one got the three wings meal with two sides and ate every bit! Very nice. BTW our meal totaled $20 and some change. Not bad for a meal that was worth every penny. The restaurant was beginning to fil before we left.  They are located in a Mountain Island shopping center in the Northwest corner of Mt. Holly-Huntersville Road & Highway 16. Trees may obscure your view but it is there. I found the shopping center to be nice and quiet on a warm Saturday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shared business info
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Restaurant interior (before more folks arrived).
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catering facility

nQR5HNVqlbtXHIwqjGnFxQ.text: I would make a special trip for the beef ribs!

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oxtail, Mac and cheese and cabbage
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef ribs, collards and Mac and cheese
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Candied yams

KmCtwfTrRII-5ZjV58Tkdg.text: I stopped in to get a bite to eat, just knowing that it would be really good. I saw that Anthony Hamilton was.there a week before for a book signing event. First of all the food is sort of served  buffet style, luckily it's not self serve. Secondly the food Is served on plastic plates. I ordered stewed chicken over rice, macaroni and cheese and collard.greens. the chicken was very bland, the macaroni and cheese was just ok and the greens were missing something. They had alot of Red pepper flakes. I wasn't too impressed with the taste of my food.

SESwnksM88UhlL2Iv7Y_zQ.text: Been here twice, the second time the food was not good. Nothing had any flavor like they missed the seasoning on everything, I had to season everything just to eat it. Won't be back

hT-KRkeYg9bVDwH1u2mvig.text: I have eaten here twice now! This is the perfect place if you are craving some good ole' southern cooking--fried chicken, mashed potatoes, meatloaf, cornbread, pinto beans, and the like. It is served cafeteria-style by friendly restaurant staff members. This place can get pretty packed on Sundays after church! The past two times I have dined here, there has been gospel music playing on the speakers. Overall, it is a bit pricey, but worth it if you are tired of chain restaurants with the same food options. I would not recommend coming here if you are vegan or vegetarian as most of the food is likely cooked with animal fat (bacon grease, etc). I have heard that the fish is great here as well, but have not had the opportunity to try it! If you're looking for a healthy meal, I'm not so sure this would be the best place but definitely recommended if you're seeking a home cooked meal.

yx38TCLSDL4AH0FeA7x1hQ.text: This place hands down some good old fashion southern comfort food. It's in a quiet little place and the hospitality they show matches the food, just good to the last piece. We were able to meet Londa the owner and she seemed very nice and blessed. The workers were well mannered and catered to our needs. We had the collard greens, Mac n cheese, yams, beef ribs and some good caramel cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef ribs, collard greens, and yams and cornbread

lAbu2tnUzrJd-25AnJ8t9g.text: Pulled turkey, rice, mac and cheese and greens. This was the perfect stop for my Sunday dinner, I mean PERFECT! I wasn't able to eat it all in one sitting, I had lunch for two days.   The service was friendly, Londas's has a family vibe. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

zUKa_oGJB71nZ2288VsIlg.text: The worst first experience every. I will not come to this place again.  Eating with my family I ordered my food that never came.  I went to the counter the lady serving said she had just thrown my ticket away. She asked if I still wanted my fish I said no I would just get something else. Everything I wanted she said there was an extra charge which I was not going to pay anything else. After a couple of selections I just said give my money back. I do not recommend this place.

EMthBNQJegKHHKqETX0GDA.text: I took a group of students here back in the Spring and we had traced from New Orleans to Virginia and it was by far one of the best rated restaurants on the tour. I can't wait to go back to Charlotte to visit it again and have told many many people about it.

99PssWN1Cq48OGG6M4dnDg.text: Delicous Cafeteria Style soul food. This is not a buffet as it states in other reviews. Anyway the food is fresh and yummy just like grandma's. I've had the fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, collard greens. My husband had the Swai (fish) Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The service was amazing for a cafeteria style. Smiles greeted us as soon as we opened the door. The place was spotless as well. I've been a few times and they have been consistently good

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious

wwtwRvAjv_Y1xC5hxripDg.text: This quaint place is my favorite go to for home cooked meals. They range from vegetable plates to ribs and turkey legs. I have not had a bad meal here yet which I'm surprised this is my first entry. The ambiance is homey with the cooks greeting you once you walk in the door. If there is a line, it moves pretty fast. They first allow you to choose from the vegetables they have that day. Then on to your choice of meats. I have had the ribs, meatloaf, pork chops, it is ALL very delicious. If you are looking for a nice home cooked meal with family that's not your own, look no further!

Q-YSZrSbjO7hxj8wlTKNrg.text: First time I went in and brought 8 church members with me.  Overall the food was good. My smothered pork chop was too tough to cut with the little plastic fork and knife that they give you.  The greens had too much sugar.  Everything else was good: sweet potatoes, corn bread and peach cobbler.  Everyone enjoyed their food for the most part. One person got the beef ribs which she said was too tough.    2nd time, I brought 10 people with me. I got the stewed chicken which was all wings and very little meat.  It comes with rice which I found out that the pork chop also comes with rice.  But, no one told me that the first time.  I asked if I could get the rice separate - I didn't want the chicken on top of the rice.  They said no, they had to serve the chicken on top of rice.  I wanted the rice separate because I wanted to get the black eye peas and put those on top.  I ended up getting sweet potatoes and greens again.  Greens were much better the 2nd time. One person got the smothered pork chop and she said it was very tender this time.  It's a nice big and clean place.  It's set up cafeteria style. They get crowded on Sundays (both times we came on Sunday).  They are super slow at serving.  The line was almost out the door but could've moved faster if the service was more efficient.  We'll probably go back because it's affordable, they can accommodate large groups and the food is good for the most part although not always consistent.

zxqqCGTIs2_S7BwMKeEABA.text: Londa's Place is a buffet style, soul food restaurant with a good location.   I agree with the reviews by Ashley D. and Chris H. Clean facility, courteous staff, wide selection, and decent prices.  My fried chicken was lightly breaded (not battered), moist and tasty.  Everyone has their riff on mac-n-cheese.  Londa's I'd order again.  Her collards, however, were good but I'm not keen on the sweetness.  Overall, a pleasant experience and looking forward to tasting some of her other fixins.  When in the area I say "Give Londa's Place a soulful whirl!"

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Swai (whiting), cabbage and collards, $7.95
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lightly breaded fried chicken, mac-n-cheese, and collard greens.

fPnYHuDvT0Dv_uf0s9si0Q.text: Today was my first time eating at Londa's Place. I was not impressed at all.  I was given 1 Turkey wing, half done butter beans and chewy fatback. The only good thing(s) were the green beans and sweet tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States

AEnmV2xDmVj0JWmmjJp2fw.text: This place is GREAT. Like no other soul food place in charlotte. I have been to multiple and this one is the best. Its not just good soul food, its GOOD FOOD -period. The chicken is some of the best, the mac and cheese is mmm mmm good, and the people are nice. Dont let the long line frighten you, it moves quickly, and even if it didnt its worth the wait. This place over delivered for me and i hope it does the same for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best chicken, some good greens, and mmm mmm good mac and cheese

J4X_3B5G3V-QLTC3g0pySw.text: After hearing a friend of mine racing about the food at Londas I finally had an opportunity to try it, and was quite honestly disappointed.  The food is OK, but in my opinion nothing to write home about, but the pricing is the most disappointing. I had a three item vegetable plate with cornbread and a medium size styrofoam cup of ice tea, and banana pudding. My bill was $13.45. Plus, I had no one ever ask if I needed anything, which I did in the way of more tea. Didn't know if I had to refill my own, and even if I was supposed to looked around and found no refill beverage area. In summary I thought the food, service after seating, and especially the pricing very disappointing. And no where close to comparing with other nearby home cooking places like Circle G, and Stockyard Grill. These two latter named restaurants have both been in business for decades. I doubt Londas will last any where the number of years.

bYef26YopgpN3cZCGZTuVg.text: This place is in an old cicis pizza spot southern cooking but we have visit twice and food wasn't hot like Luke warm to cold and a lil pricey last time we ordered got home and had the last piece of chicken over the fence with a few feathers so she wasn't happy I love southern soul food but this needs a lot of lessons from granmas kitchen

a9r5Yk6B5GMhL-Kvl9No1w.text: The service was good. Everyone was nice. However the food wasn't really seasoned well.

photos.caption: Photo of Londa's Place - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smothered pork chops

PX-msCFtGit_gLajBwzMuQ.text: Great food, seasoned well..Londa is a great business woman and owner, she will definitely go far with her attentiveness to her customers. I will definitely be making this a regular stop to get dinner.

P9bLhoLDZrZrB_aDHuHD2g.text: Yum. My parents and I went to Londa's Place this afternoon for lunch and they both were wondering why it wasn't PACKED because the food was so good. The service is "elementary lunchroom" style (you tell them what you want and they pile it on your plate). They have different veggies and meats every day. Your typical plate come with a meat and two veggies. I had smothered steak (on a bed of rice) with candied yams and green beans. Just like grandma's house. The steak was moist and juicy, the candied yams were perfectly sweet and the green beans were green beany.   It is tucked away off of 485 in a strip mall with a bunch of fast food and pizza chains, but definitely worth seeking out if you're looking for a good homemade meal without the cooking or cleaning.
